p: In the present work, five essential oils obtained from the wood of P. nigra subsp. nigra (PNI) and P. heldreichii (PHE), needles of P. pinea (PPI), and fruits of J. turbinata (JTU) and J. oxycedrus subsp. deltoides (JOX) were studied. The isolation of the essential oils was carried out using Microwave-Assisted Hydrodistillation (MAHD), a ‘‘green’’ technique that is used both at the research and industrial level due to efficient heating, fast energy transfer, and environmental friendliness [ 30]. The volume and yield of the recovered EOs are presented in Table S1 (supplementary materials).
